etymologies: late Middle English (also in the sense ‘merit’): from Old French desmerite or Latin demeritum ‘something deserved’, neuter past participle of demereri, from de- ‘thoroughly’ (also understood in medieval Latin as denoting reversal) + mereri ‘to merit’

definitions: a feature or fact deserving censure

examples.text: the merits and demerits of these proposals

definitions: a mark awarded against someone for a fault or offense.
shortDefinitions: mark awarded against someone for fault or offence
